description.narrative: With the funds, the Escuela de Agroecologia de Santa Isabel aims to help improve the quality of life within Santa Isabel and link conservation of forest biodiversity with the recuperation of agricultural diversity to guarantee food sovereignty. Poverty within Ecuador, particularly in Santa Isabel, is very severe and greatly affects women, who are both often responsible for the survival of their families and whose rights are frequently denied. Communities have little resources to protect their territories or water from the growth and destruction of the extractive industry, which has been granted 45,000 hectares in concessions. To provide the communities of Santa Isabel, especially women, stronger autonomy and sovereignty over their food, the group will organize trainings for 20 male and female farmers from several communities and create 20 experimental UPAS (Solidarity Agroecological Production Units). These UPAS's will act as healthy agricultural models which will improve food sovereignty both for the beneficiaries of the project and for the population of Santa Isabel Canton. Additionally, the group will develop a commercial system through which consumers can buy directly from producers
